Criteria.3: Accomplishing
Dresses self independently/needs assistance with zipper
Criteria.name: dresses

Criteria.3: Washes and dries hands completely when prompted
Criteria.name: washes_hands

Criteria.2: In a defined space-moves with little control/little awareness of surroundings
Criteria.3: In a defined space-moves with purpose and control
Criteria.name: moves

Criteria.2: Jumps 1 or 2 feet take off/1 foot landing
Criteria.3: Jumps with control/2 feet take off and landing
Criteria.name: jumps

Criteria.3: Balances 5 or more seconds
Criteria.name: balances

Criteria.2: Kicks ball with only forward motion-push
Criteria.3: Kicks ball with backward and forward motion
Criteria.name: kicks

Criteria.1: Misses the ball when attempts to catch
Criteria.2: Traps ball against body when catching
Criteria.3: Catches ball with hands away from body
Criteria.name: catches

Criteria.1: Attempts to throw but no forward motion
Criteria.2: Throws with forward motion but off target
Criteria.3: Throws with control and accuracy
Criteria.name: throws
Criteria.header: Throws a small ball or bean bag overhand with accuracy.

Criteria.2: Cuts a shape but needs assistance (cues-thumb up, hold paper)
Criteria.3: Cuts a simple shape within 1/4-inch line independently
Criteria.name: scissors

Criteria.3: Copy 3-4 shapes
Criteria.name: copies_shapes

Criteria.1: Draw a person with 1-2 body parts
Criteria.2: Draw a person with 3-4 body parts
Criteria.3: Draw a person with 5-6 distinguishable and connected body parts
Criteria.4: Draw a person with distinguishable and connected head, body, eyes, nose, mouth, arms, legs
Criteria.name: draws_person
recognizes_caregiver
Criteria.header: Recognizes care giver's name when heard (Is your mom's name ___?)

Criteria.name: states_caregiver
Criteria.header: Can state care giver's name when asked (Who takes care of you at home?)

Criteria.3: Undecided
Criteria.name: hand_dominance

Criteria.3: Pincer
Criteria.name: pencil_grip

Criteria.3: Accomplishing

Criteria.1: Has difficulty differentiating one emotion from another
Criteria.2: With verbal cue (are you feeling sad, or you look angry. Is that how you feel?) identifies when they are feeling happy, sad or angry
Criteria.3: Verbally identifies when they are feeling happy, sad or angry independently or when asked how they are feeling
Criteria.4: Verbally identifies additional emotions when experiencing them (ie,frustrated, surprised, etc.)
Criteria.name: express_emotions

Criteria.1: No or little control over emotional reactions even with prompt from adult
Criteria.2: Gains control of emotions when prompted by an adult
Criteria.3: Emotional response is developmentally appropriate to most situations
Criteria.4: Emotional response is developmentally appropriate to all situations
Criteria.name: control_emotions

Criteria.1: Does not respond/is not aware of others feelings
Criteria.2: Is able to identify/recognize the feelings of others
Criteria.3: Uses words or actions to comfort others when they are distressed
Criteria.4: Takes additional  action to improve the situation to try to assist others when they are distressed
Criteria.name: empathy

Criteria.1: Engages in solitary or parallel play only (plays next to others not with them)
Criteria.2: Interacts with one child at a time
Criteria.3: Interacts with more than one child at a time
Criteria.4: Interacts with multiple children in multiple situations
Criteria.name: coop_play

Criteria.2: Responds to direction with 1- 2 verbal prompts
Criteria.3: Follows routines independently
Criteria.name: follow_routines

Criteria.2: Responds to direction with 1- 2 verbal prompts
Criteria.3: Follows rules independently
Criteria.name: follow_rules

Criteria.1: Unable to solve problems with appropriate words/actions
Criteria.2: Needs teacher coaching to solve conflicts
Criteria.3: Able to suggest possible solutions to conflict with teacher prompting and  then follows through independently to solve the conflict
Criteria.name: solve_conflicts

Criteria.3: Accomplishing

Criteria.1: Follow a single direction with adult assistance
Criteria.2: Follow a single direction or two-step directions with reminders
Criteria.3: Independently follow two step directions
Criteria.name: follow_directions

Criteria.1: Does not respond or responds nonverbally
Criteria.2: Respond verbally with prompting or provides an off-topic response
Criteria.3: Provide a verbal, on topic response
Criteria.name: responds
Criteria.header: Respond to requests for information and questions when asked

Criteria.1: Express self non-verbally or using one or two words
Criteria.2: Express self using 3-4 phrases and sentences
Criteria.3: Express self using five to six word sentences
Criteria.name: expresses_self
Criteria.header: Express self using words phrases and/or complete thoughts

Criteria.1: Attempt to sequence an event with assistance
Criteria.2: Sequence three steps of an activity with support
Criteria.3: Sequence three steps of an activity
Criteria.4: Sequence four steps of an activity
Criteria.name: sequence_steps
Criteria.header: Sequence steps of an activity (encourage student to verbalize, but don’t score explanation)

Criteria.1: Need assistance to recognize first name in print.
Criteria.2: Recognize only first letter of name in print.
Criteria.3: Recognize first name in print
Criteria.name: recognize_name

Criteria.3: Name all or at least 5 letters of first name in random order
Criteria.name: letter_in_name
Criteria.header: Name the letters in my name

Criteria.3: Recognizes 12-21 letters
Criteria.name: recognize_uppercase

Criteria.3: Recognizes 12-21 letter sounds
Criteria.name: recognize_letter_sounds
books
Criteria.header: Looks at books only when teacher initiates

Criteria.name: story_time
Criteria.header: Participates in story time (filling in words and phrases), teacher initiated

Criteria.name: curiosity
Criteria.header: Displays curiosity, risk-taking, and willingness to engage in new experiences

Criteria.name: actions
Criteria.header: Watches and imitates the actions of others

Criteria.name: real_use
Criteria.header: Uses objects in pretend play as they are used in real life

Criteria.name: imaginative_use
Criteria.header: Uses objects in pretend play in an imaginative way (ie: block as phone, kleenex as blanket)

Criteria.name: supported_activity
Criteria.header: Persists with an activity when supported by an adult

Criteria.name: independent_action
Criteria.header: Persists with an activity independently through completion

Criteria.3: Accomplishing

Criteria.1: Counts 0-4 objects one at a time
Criteria.2: Counts 5-7 objects one at a time
Criteria.3: Counts 8-10 objects one at a time
Criteria.4: Counts more than 10 objects one at a time
Criteria.name: count_object

Criteria.3: Counts to 13-15
Criteria.name: count_outloud

Criteria.3: Names 8 – 10 random numbers
Criteria.name: identify_numbers

Criteria.1: Attempts to make sets of objects when asked
Criteria.2: Gives the teacher two objects, three objects, or four objects when asked
Criteria.3: Gives the teacher five objects when asked
Criteria.4: Gives the teacher six or more objects when asked
Criteria.name: make_sets

Criteria.3: Names 3 shapes
Criteria.4: Names 4 or more shapes (rectangle, oval, hexagon…)
Criteria.name: name_shapes

Criteria.3: Names 5 - 7 colors
Criteria.name: name_colors

Criteria.1: Compares two sets of objects and recognizes 1 of the following: more, less, same
Criteria.2: Compares two sets of objects and recognizes 2 of the following: more, less, same
Criteria.3: Compares two sets of objects and recognizes more, less, same
Criteria.4: Compares two sets of objects and can identify how many more or less is in the set
Criteria.name: recognize_lms
Criteria.header: Recognize less, more and the same

Criteria.3: Demonstrates 3 of the directions/ locations
Criteria.4: Demonstrates 4 or more of the directions/ locations
Criteria.name: understand_direction
Criteria.header: Understand direction and location (behind, below, over, under, above, on, next to…)

Criteria.1: Demonstrates zero or one of the three concepts
Criteria.2: Demonstrates two of the three concepts
Criteria.3: Demonstrates three of the three concepts
Criteria.4: In addition, puts 3 or more objects in order using one of the concepts (ie: short, med, tall, small, med, large)
Criteria.name: compare_height
Criteria.header: Compare height (taller/shorter), length (longer, shorter), weight (heavier, lighter) of two objects

Criteria.2: Sorts objects by one attribute with support (cues, prompts)
Criteria.3: Sorts objects by one attribute independently
Criteria.4: Sorts objects by more than one attribute or can explain
Criteria.name: sort_objects

Criteria.2: Copies a pattern following a model (e.g., red blue red blue)
Criteria.3: Extends a pattern (e.g., red blue red blue . . . what’s next?)
Criteria.name: makes_patterns
